content: I've been unable to play my app for a couple of days, and it was buggy before. I'm unable to use the app since I can't retrieve games or start any new ones.
Lightweight dice chucker
Good quick game that's easy and fun to kill a few minutes
Good game
The game seems fun, but the AI looks to be unbeatable.
Fun distraction
Meh too many bugs. Freezes, not user friendly.
A whole lotta fun!
Fun and fast game
Positively addictive!!!
Do not buy the extra dice. Fun game, but the extra content is a waste.
Okay app. Not the MOST user friendly. Definitely need to add a way to leave a game
Great game. The kids and I really enjoy playing it together. Easy to pick up and anyone can play
Just like Tsuro, the design here is a masterclass in how to make a board game adaptation with minimal UI. Well done.
Great game
Had issues with multiplayer, dev refunded.
This is a great game for playing while waiting, whether the wait is in line or at a restaurant.
Simple, pointless, frustrating game. Doesn't give all the Google Play rewards. Contacted dev twice but he never replied, so he gets a bad review here!!

I never downloaded this. I purchased Cashflow and added it to my family library, but when I tried to re-download it, this game is somehow in my apps list and Play store wants to charge me for Cashflow. Very disappointing.
I wish I could stop the animation and make it more 2D. A skip not rolls options would be nice. I don't care watching them roll. Speed up the gameplay.
I love finding app versions of my favorite games.
AI keeps crashing. After a couple of turns when it's the AI's turn it freezes.
Fun!
going to buy the deluxe version!!

They need to make it so the person has to do their turn right away. After you do your turn the person can take DAYS to do their turn... Why would I want to start up 20 games, hoping I will find one person that will do their turn at a reasonable time. Just make people play until the game is finished with a 1 minute timer or something. I have multiple unfinished games now. What's the point?
Really enjoy playing this, love that I can now trigger dice with a tap or a slide. Great game!
Fun quick game. Excellent graphics and audio. Multi-player is well implemented with a nice UI.
Great game, simple to learn, tricky to master, yet totally worth it!
can't seem to play with people and bots together. also i have a 2 player have in progress where the cards showing up on our phones are different from each other. we can't seem to clear that game
Awesome game!
awsome like the real dicegamr
This game is fun. just hate when it changes orientation by itself
one of my favorite light board games. I carry it wherever I go and teach it to my non-gaming friends. Now I take it on the go. Awesome!
love the game. downside is i have a motorola, so when i shake the phone to roll the dice, it will usually turn on the light or activate the camera.
Fun
Another great Calliope game that I can play with family members of all ages!
Fun game which doesn't take too long.
addictive and easy to lose time playing
Fun quick game to play when waiting
replyContent: Hi, Paul. Thanks for the review. Good news: you can change the roll to a tap in the settings.

content: very thankful that the orientation can be fixed into one position. (confusingly in the "tilt to zoom setting") can we decide what the winning score is next?
replyContent:
You are welcome, Rick!
Setting the winning score is currently our most popular request, and under serious consideration for the next update.

content: A great port of a fun game. I also did something I don't do with apps, I did an in app purchase and added all the upgrades. Having different dice to choose from is fun. Definitely worth a couple of dollars you do get more than your money's worth in fun.

Although I love game itself - this implementation is terrible IMO. Attempt to implement physics of reality is annoying. It makes game slower than in real life and generally feels awkward. You will need a powerbank to play as it will drain battery as if it's mining bitcoins. Online gaming experience is awfully buggy. And as a cherry on top of all - you will have to pay like extra 3-5USD just to get better deck shuffle and extra cards (from deluxe box)...
replyContent: Hi, Alexey - sorry to hear this. You can switch the graphics to Eco. Mode to save battery. Regarding the deluxe features, we wanted a low price for the base game, but allow people who enjoyed it to enhance it if desired. We take customer value seriously, so feel free to drop me a line on dan@thunderboxentertainment.com if you would like a refund.

content: Add a button to roll dice so that I don't have to sit and shake my phone or tablet. Also, allowing the player to zoom in or out would be handy.
replyContent:
Already done it, Chris! üòé
You can switch the roll to a tap or swipe in the settings, and tilting your device will zoom in and out (landscape = full tactical view, portrait = one-handed play).
Let us know how you get on!

content: Great translation of the card game. Fun for online play, Pass and Play an against AI.

I had been having problems with a Google lookalike webpage (livemobilesearch) constantly opening on my phone. Tried everything to get rid of the problem and finally downloaded AVG to try to get to the bottom of it. It flagged this game as containing Malware, so I deleted it and the problem has stopped.
replyContent: Thanks for the info, Libby. We investigated this issue a while ago, and you should only see this phenomenon with old, pirated versions of the game. The latest update has had all virus false-positives removed, and has been fully checked, and confirmed clean. Please e-mail dan@thunderboxentertainment.com and we will get this sorted for you ASAP.

content: love this game! it's so easy to learn and super fun!!

The game is fun. The AI is fast, but it would be nice if there were different levels to the AI since not many real people play it for online matches. Maybe add challenges to the game, that would be fun.

Currently discussing with them about the issue with the notifications, putting three stars in the meantime.  Updated to one star for showing ads of other games as notifications. Twice. Under two categories. Really bad practice.  Implementation wise, it seems really solid. It also has a nice set of options and very reasonable payment options inside the game. The only thing lacking a bit is the game itself. It's nice for a bit but there's not much depth to it. In any case, I'd recommend it.
replyContent:
Hi, Jorge, this doesn't sound right - Roll For It should be 100% ad free. 
Please drop us a line via our website so we can get a bit more info and we can investigate.
http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content: The only thing that would make this better is if we could choose what score to play to.

This is a faithful port of the physical board game and is fun. There was a bug that would cause massive data usage (1.7 GB in a month) but Can worked with me to squash that bug. Game runs perfectly and recreates the card game experience. Highly suggest, especially for its price.
replyContent:
Hi, Jeff,
Are you using the latest version? This bug has been found and crushed since v1.3. :)
Drop us a line via our website if the issue still persists.
http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content: Awesome rendition by thunderbox, as usual... except for the device shaking imposition (you gotta cut that nonsense, figure out another randomizer), I think the the main real issue here, is the original game. It's just not that fun of a game.

Thanks, Guillaume.
You can switch the shake to a tap or a swipe in the settings!

content: Only 3 cards and you have to scroll to see them? Why can't I zoom out? Why can't you turn off shake and just have it auto-roll them on your turn? I accidentally hit the recall dice action and there's no undo? Sorry guys, but this implementation is just BAD.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback Aaron.
You can tilt your phone to zoom out, and switch the shake to a tap in the options.
The Undo function should work with recall... we will investigate that one!

content: While I understand shaking the device to roll is on theme, after a couple of rounds it get annoying, especially since it's not very sensitive and I have to shake my phone very hard. This could be very uncomfortable for people with wrist issues. Needs a more sublte option for rolling.
replyContent: Very true, Michael! You can adjust shake sensitivity, or just switch to a tap in the settings. :D

content: Lots of fun. Great graphics.
replyContent: Thanks! :D

content: Lots of fun!

content: The game is fun and solid. But something is wrong with the programming. I only ever used it to play solo, while wifi was on, but it still used tons of data. 1.6 gb in a few weeks, sometimes while my phone was off. It makes me question why. Combined with the massive amount of permissions the game asks for, I do not trust it. It has been deleted.
replyContent: Apologies - v1.4.1 fixes this once and for all! :)

content: Fun & challenging!

content:
I downloaded this app when it was on sale. It has been draining my battery 
ever since I first opened. I haven't played it in about a week. But when I 
checked my phone after after sleeping 10 hours last night and my battery 
status was only at 78% and my phone indicated that this app has used 86% of 
my battery usage since the last full charge. I'll consider reinstalling if 
this issue is fixed. Otherwise I enjoy this app.
replyContent: Please grab the latest update (v1.2). Battery life is all fixed! Apologies for the inconvenience.

content:
The shaking the mobile to roll the dice is a little annoying. The game 
itself is alright but I've ninstalled due to the game sapping battery power 
even when not loaded since a restart of the device. 14% useage! Ouch.
replyContent: Hi there! Apologies for the inconvenience - battery life is now fixed in the latest update (v1.2). You can switch the shaking to a tap or a swipe in the settings. Let us know how you get on! :)

content:
I own a LG 4G phone, I installed this game 2 weeks ago and everything ran 
fine. This past week we went on vacation. Halfway though the week my 
YouTube app had the sounds go in and out. I at first thought it was just 
the video I was watching so I didn't think much of it. Later when we were 
driving Google Maps wouldn't update the streets and the sound wouldn't 
speak, very frustrating while on vacation and don't know where you are. My 
music and podcasts apps wouldn't play longer than 30 seconds. My phone 
would not charge or hold a charge long. I killed all apps and restarted my 
phone multiple times and nothing got better. I went into the setting in my 
phone and found that this app was draining my battery and the data usage 
said it had used over a GB of data in a day. I hadn't opened the app since 
it was installed. Once I deleted the app, all functions returned to normal.
replyContent:
So sorry to read this! We have totally fixed all battery and data issues in the new version (v1.2).  Feel free to get in touch via our website so we can issue a more in-depth apology.  :( :( :(

http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

Hi, Vanessa.
Thanks for the great review.
Drop us a line via our website and we can sort out your dice and frozen games.

http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content: Awesome game

content: The app implementation is OK. Overproduced for what it is. The underlying game itself is pretty bad. I've played the physical copy a couple of times with friends, and I didn't enjoy it either time.  I thought a single-player app version might be pretty good since there would be no downtime. Nope. It's still bad. The few choices you do have are ruined when the player after you rolls perfectly and steals a card that they didn't have any dice on previously.  Might as well be playing bunco or tensi. Hard pass. Glad I picked up the app when it was free instead of having to pay for it. Pick up Gans Shon Clever instead. Amazing dice game.

Once I got into the app it was good fun. It's not the most complex game, 
but it is a faithful (and beautiful) port of this great light dice game.
replyContent: Glad you got it working OK, Mike. Thanks for the great review! :D

content:
Why does it need so many permissions? Wants access to my photos and media, 
my location, and also wants access to make and receive calls. Then on game 
launch it then looks to access my Google profile and other details. It's a 
dice game, not a snooping tool! I love the physical Roll For It game but I 
can't recommend this with all these permission requests. Edit: further star 
knocked off for app now putting adverts in my notification bar.
replyContent:
Hi, Gordon, thanks for the info.
We have fixed all the crazy permission in the latest version (v1.2).

There shouldn't be any adverts in your notification bar though - Roll For It! is 100% ad free!  Would you be able to drop us a line via our website so we can investigate?

http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content:
Pretty fun single player but broken multiplayer. It's better to buy the

replyContent:
Hi, Dan,
It's always better to buy the physical game! :D

We are constantly working on improving the multiplayer, and this version (v1.2) is our best yet.
Please drop us a line if you have anything specific we can investigate for you!

http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content:
It's a very good implementation of a tabletop game. But, the game isn't

content: Great game. Simple yet entertaining.

content: FUN there's nothing boring or bad about the game

content:
Great game that simulates the physical dice game well with interesting AI 
that can "troll" you. The only things I would criticize are that the dice 
rolling prompt obscures the player scores during your turn which makes it 
difficult to decide whether you should recall your dice, and sometimes 
achievements get blocked, e.g., the "Mystic Stone" disappears, I've already 
bought all the dice, etc. Otherwise great fun.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback, Joseph, we will look into those items for sure!
Glad you found the hidden Troll AI!!! :D

content:
Permissions are ridiculous, presumably hoping to get totally unnecessary 
info out of unobservant people. Game mechanic itself is dull, stick to 
Yahztee for more of a skill game
replyContent: Hi, Phil, the permissions are all fixed in the latest update (v1.2).

content: Awesome to play with your friends.

Sharing the player code is a pain. Facebook sucks, not everyone has it, and 
it took forever to figure out how to create a login for this. Also, a game 
my wife set up went wrong where the cards on my screen were different than 
the ones on her screen, even though my dice appeared on her incorrect 
cards. Other than that, it's a fun game.

It's a fun game, very quick and easy to play. I think the app could use 
some more optimization. I have an S8 but it sometimes lags and stutters.

Been playing with my nephew. It's alright, but can take a while if you're 
playing the cards with 6 dice. It's best to bet on the lower died cards
replyContent:
That is a very good tip, Jozef.
Stay away from the 15 point cards for an easier win!
Only go big if you are feeling lucky and want to show-boat!

content: Easy to play very fun
Great port of the fun dice game.

A fun little dice game with beautiful graphics. It's as tactile a game as 
I've ever played. My one complaint is that the achievements don't always 
work properly. The one for buying new dice didn't trigger for me, for 
example, and now it never will. :(
You want me to shake my whole device to play? Hard pass
replyContent: Hi, Jeff - worry ye not! In the settings there is an option to switch the shake to a flick or a swipe. Easy. :)

content:
Fairly simple game, and I know confirmation bias is a thing, but if the 
dice vs the AI are truly random, I'll eat my hat. I've played several games 
now and have yet to win because you simply don't get the numbers you need. 
Also REALLY needs a roll button. Shaking the phone gets old fast.
replyContent:
You want fries with that hat? üçüüé©üòâ
I can guarantee that all dice rolls are 100% random.
You are right about confirmation bias - it does FEEL like the AI are cheating... but they are totally not. We want to keep the game as realistic as possible, so sometimes players can just be mega unlucky. And you can change the roll to a tap in the settings.üé≤

content:
Game is fun, but most of the buttons in the settings don't work. Yes, I've

replyContent:
That sounds like a bug - please get in touch via our website and we can investigate. Thanks!

content: A fun and easy game to play!

This game is fun and the rules are simple. There is a huge problem though. 
The app doesn't respect auto-rotate settings. Locking my screen in 
landscape won't prevent the app from rotating to portrait mode when the 
device is turned. This wouldn't be a huge problem, ex excspt the game is 
almost unplayable in portrait because you have to scroll constantly.
replyContent: Hi, Ethan, thanks for the update. We've added a tilt lock feature to the settings. Tap on the Gear, then MORE then TILT TO ZOOM. That should fix it!

content: Why the hell you need my device location and MANAGE CALLS permissions?
replyContent:
Hi, Yurii,
That's a very good question!

Roll For It! doesn't need this permission... it  crept into the app by mistake, and will be removed in the next update (available shortly).

In the meantime, please feel free to deny the permission request - it will have no effect on the game.

Apologies for any inconvenience or confusion caused!

content: I love the table top version and this is just like it.

content:
Love it! But please get auto lock. This should have been included for the 
price I paid. You would think if the developers had tested this properly 
they would have been very annoyed by it not autolocking and it constantly 
switching all the time.
replyContent:
Hi there! Thanks for the great review.

For some reason, a few device's Autolock settings don't get passed through to Roll For It... That's why we added a setting to disable the "Tilt to Zoom" function. Open the menu, tap the gear icon, tap "MORE", then tap "TILT TO ZOOM" and your orientation will lock.

:D

content:

replyContent:
Thanks for the thoughtful feedback, Eric. We'll see if we can address some of those points for the next update! :)

UPDATE: Rotation lock is ready to go for the next update... coming soon!
That creeping lag you mention sounds unusual... please drop us a line via our website so we can investigate ASAP! 

http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content: Good
replyContent: Thanks! :D

content: As a fan of roll for it, I'm thrilled to see such a clean, well done app for the game. As much fun as the real life version and a great way to kill time in between other things or introduce someone to the game on the go.
replyContent: Thanks, Tina. Roll For It! is a great game... all we had to do is not mess with it. :D

content: Excellent game, but unfortunately i purchased it on my tablet and then my phone using the same google account. I then purchased the total red box and all dice, but unfortunately it will not work on my phone. Could someone please help.
replyContent: Hi, Gary. Drop us a line via our website and we will sort you out ASAP!

content: Love the game, easy to find friends, family share is awesome. Only critique I have is that sometimes when I'm bouncing back and forth between apps Roll For It will have to completely restart. Haven't found any rhyme or reason for it yet but the running in background could use some tweaking... on my phone at least (LG G5)
replyContent: Thanks, Derek - we will investigate!

content: Soooo disappointed in this. The auto rotation is too touchy. Any prompt (such as when trying to exit the game) is blank (just white bar). Can't change AI level in options.....brutal. i love Roll for it (have the gold tin), but this was a waste of money. Not a fan of having to shake my phone...just let me tap the screen to roll!  P.s. It seems tap to roll is an option but i couldn't select it because the options section does not change when i click things.  I reinstalled the game and tap to roll seemed to be setup this time.  Currently reinstalling now to see what else may work. ...4th time. :(
replyContent:
Hi, Paul, sounds like you are having some trouble with Roll For It! Most of what you describe should definitely not be that way! You can change AI and Roll Method in the options, and we will be adding a rotation lock in the first update.  Please drop us a line via our website and we will get you sorted!
http://thunderboxentertainment.com/#contact

content: Love the game, but the lagging is crazy!!!  It shouldn't take that long to place my dice.  Fix that and my star rating will be back to 5!
Great implementation of the physical game, don't expect too much depth, fun little timewaster
replyContent: Thanks for the balanced review, Michael!

content: Great game! Really captures the look and feel of the physical game.
replyContent: Thanks, Eric! Glad you are having fun. :D

content: Been playing this game since it was just a demo board game. This mobile adaptation does the game justice! Great all around!
replyContent: Thanks, Chris! Much appreciated. :D

content: Great game on day of launch. Look forward to some improvements. Finding a random online player would make this 5 stars.
replyContent:
Hi there!
Thanks for the feedback.
Have you tried the Automatch feature?
It might be a  bit quiet while we start up, but games will stay active for a week so players have plenty of time to join.
You can find more info on this and other cool features in our FAQ: http://thunderboxentertainment.com/rfifaq/

content: Love this game in real life and on this app. My son and I can spend all day playing.
replyContent: Thanks! So glad you are enjoying the game. :D

content: Looks great, and I love the physical shaking of the dice! The AI is good but I look forward to playing my friends!
replyContent: Shake it up, Alex! Glad to hear you are rolling like a boss! :D
